alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Northern Gila County; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 1:07PM MST until January 04 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON MST THURSDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Alpine, Buffalo Pass, Dilkon, Eagar-Springerville, Forest Lakes, Ganado, Heber- Overgaard, Kykotsmovi, Payson, Pine-Strawberry, Pinetop- Lakeside, Saint Johns, Shonto, Show Low, Whiteriver and Window Rock. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to noon MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Snow forecast from 10 PM Today to noon Thursday: Alpine 3 to 5 inches Buffalo Pass 4 to 8 inches Dilkon 1 to 2 inches Eagar-Sprgrvlle 1 to 2 inches Forest Lakes 2 to 4 inches Ganado 3 to 5 inches Heber-Overgaard 1 to 2 inches Kykotsmovi 0 to 1 inches Payson 0 to 1 inches Pine-Strawberry 1 to 3 inches Pinetop-Lkside 3 to 5 inches Saint Johns 0 to 1 inches Shonto 1 to 3 inches Show Low 1 to 3 inches Whiteriver 1 to 2 inches Window Rock 3 to 5 inches .
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
